message_1: Assume that you have to send a message "HELLO" using the one-time pad encryption method. Your one-time pad key is "QWERT", where each character represents a number from 0 to 25 in alphabetical order (A=0, B=1, C=2, and so on). Use modular arithmetic to encrypt the message and write the encrypted message.
message_2:
To encrypt the message "HELLO" using the one-time pad key "QWERT", we will use modular arithmetic. First, we need to convert each letter in the message and the key to their corresponding numerical values:

Message: HELLO
Numerical values: 7 (H), 4 (E), 11 (L), 11 (L), 14 (O)

Key: QWERT
Numerical values: 16 (Q), 22 (W), 4 (E), 17 (R), 19 (T)

Now, we will add the numerical values of the message and the key using modular arithmetic (mod 26):

7 (H) + 16 (Q) = 23 (mod 26) => 23 = X
4 (E) + 22 (W) = 0 (mod 26) => 0 = A
11 (L) + 4 (E) = 15 (mod 26) => 15 = P
11 (L) + 17 (R) = 2 (mod 26) => 2 = C
14 (O) + 19 (T) = 7 (mod 26) => 7 = H

The encrypted message is "XAPCH".
